item.title: Hyrule Warriors: Age Of Imprisonment Receives Its First Switch 2 Update (Version 1.0.1)
item.content:encoded:
Here's what you can expect

Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment is out today on the Switch 2, and as part of the launch, Nintendo has rolled out the first game update, bumping the title up to Version 1.0.1.

This launch patch includes multiple fixes, resolving issues tied to Split Screen, gameplay, GameShare and more. There's also a new shortcut feature added. Here's the full rundown, courtesy of Nintendo's official support page:

Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment - Version 1.0.1 (5th November 2025)

Latest update: Ver. 1.0.1 (Released November 5, 2025)

Fixed Issues

  • Fixed an issue where progress would stop when player discovered a Korok under specific conditions when playing two-player Split Screen.
  • Fixed an issue where the screen would go dark and it would be impossible to progress when quitting a battle during the animation for “Temporal Counter.”
  • Fixed an issue where progress stopped sometimes when trying to start a battle, when quitting the communication for GameShare.
  • Several other issues have been fixed.

Feature Added

  • Added shortcut feature (Y button) to the Aside Quests on the map screen.

If we find out anything else about this first game update for Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment, we'll let you know. And if you want to learn more about this new Hyrule Warriors game, check out our review here on Nintendo Life. Here's a quick sample:

"With Zonai devices to play with, a cracking roster, tons of sexy Sync Strikes to pull off, and a ludicrously slick recreation of early Hyrule to set about kicking ass in, this is dream time for hack-and-slash fans and Zelda enthusiasts alike. Yes, map layouts are still a bit bland, and co-op mode is 30fps, but everything else here combines to make for the best entry in this spin-off franchise to date."

Will you be getting this game? How are you finding it so far? Let us know.

[source en-americas-support.nintendo.com]

item.title: Kirby Air Riders Gets A Seven-Minute Overview Trailer
item.content:encoded:
Racing onto Switch 2 later this month

If you're still not sure about Kirby Air Riders, and somehow don't feel you've seen enough of this game yet, Nintendo has now released a new overview trailer.

Although it's in Japanese, there's plenty of footage on display that provides a recap of everything revealed during the previous two broadcasts. This includes the main modes and even mini games, and towards the end, there's another look at the new Kirby Air Riders amiibo line. When an English version of this trailer is released, we'll provide an update.

In the second Kirby Air Riders Direct, Sakurai announced the return of Top Ride, the new game mode Road Trip, and detailed online play, copy abilities, the many courses and much more.

If you want to know more about this upcoming Switch 2 release, due out on 20th November 2025, be sure to check out our previous coverage. A few other things confirmed so far include a day one update, and game director Masahiro Sakurai says there are no plans for DLC - so you can expect the entire experience at launch.

As a reminder, there's also a Kirby Air Riders Global Test Ride taking place on the Switch 2 this weekend. You can find out more about this, including the date and times, in our previous story.

Are you excited about Kirby's new racing outing? Will you be getting it on release? Let us know in the comments.

item.title: Pokémon Legends Z-A Version 1.0.2 Is Now Live, Here Are The Full Patch Notes
item.content:encoded:
Update your copy today, trainers

Following the launch of Pokémon Legends Z-A on the Switch and Switch 2 in October, Game Freak has now rolled out Version 1.0.2.

According to the Japanese website for the game, this update contains bug fixes tied to Mega Evolutions, side missions and "other issues", and also makes some adjustments to ranked battles. Here's the rundown courtesy of a rough translation, and if we get hold of the English patch notes, we'll update this post.

Pokémon Legends Z-A - Version 1.0.2 (6th November 2025)

The following bugs have been fixed:

  • If you have not opened the box screen since the box was full before the first Mega Evolution battle, you will definitely fail to capture a Pokemon. Also, if you proceed with a side mission that allows you to obtain a Pokemon in that state, you will not be able to complete it.
  • In some side missions, if the day/night change occurs at the same time that a skill is hit on a target, it will no longer be possible to hit the target with a skill, and the side mission will no longer be able to progress.
  • During a trainer battle, if the opposing trainer switches Pokemon and the player simultaneously Mega Evolves, the opposing trainer will not be able to send out a Pokemon and will be unable to proceed.
  • Fixed some other issues.

Rank Battle Balance Adjustments:

  • Adjustment of points earned based on ranking so that points are not reduced depending on the outcome of the match.
  • Some battle rewards that can be received for each battle have been added and increased.

*The latest update data is required to play online features.
*Local communication is not compatible with previous versions. Please make sure that you and the people you play with have the same update data version.

If we hear anything else significant about this latest game update, we'll let you know. And in case you missed it, The Pokémon Company has also announced it will be sharing some news about the upcoming DLC Mega Dimension later today, so be on the lookout for that.

You can find out more about Pokémon Legends Z-A for Switch and Switch 2 in our reviews here on Nintendo Life.

Have you updated your copy of Pokémon Legends Z-A yet? How are you finding the game so far? Let us know in the comments.
